metadata.dc:description: We report two cases of patients who underwent simultaneous triple transplants (liver-pancreas-kidney) using organs taken from a single donor in each case. The anesthetic technique and perioperative treatment of each patient is described. The favorable evolution in both cases seems to indicate that although this type of transplant may be more complex, it is nevertheless a good therapeutic option for patients suffering terminal liver failure, kidney failure or diabetes type I.
metadata.dc:title: Anestesia y tratamiento intraoperatorio en dos casos de trasplante simultáneo triple de hígado, páncreas y riñón.
[Anesthesia and intraoperative treatment in 2 cases of simultaneous liver, pancreas, and kidney transplantation].
